localised_description: Custom Battle skill for Caltrops and Smoke Screen
Peace is the natural state, all else is transitory.
Direct damage attack with addition of self inflicted damage.
Hurl a bundle of explosive fire bombs to knockdown the enemy.
If killed in battle increases morale of own units.
Melee splash attack with knock down effect.
Upon being reduced to 20% HP provides a morale buff to own nearby units.
These words will bring shame and humiliation.
A lifetime spent learning the ways of heaven will turn thoughts into belief.
Upon nearby enemy unit routing nearby own units recieve a morale buff.
Guo Jia can see all that was, and all that will be.
Pang Tong sacrifices himself, to aid his fellow brothers.
Using her graceful beauty, Diaochan stuns all those around her.
A hidden strike hits with more power than those that are seen.
Starts chanting, reduces morale of hostile units and increases morale of own units.
Stacking defence buff and increase to armour-piercing damage.
Increases battle movement speed of allied units.
Ranged area target debuff reducing morale of hostile units.
An innate sense of compassion and understanding for everyone defines their very essence.
To say what one means is not always the most useful of approaches. To NOT say what one means, however...
Decisions and beliefs blow upon the breeze like leaves; nobody can say where these ones will land.
They cannot sit idly by, or wait, or even contemplate – this one finds it far, far better to DO.
Whatever they can reach for, grasp or seize, you can be assured they will not miss an opportunity.
If you think that a simple matter of embarassment will stop this one from doing something, you are mistaken.
If you believe that you know what they will do, or when they will do it, then you are twice mistaken.
To be like the wind – to be everywhere and nowhere – is the essence of swiftness and elusivity.
If you spot them, then it is quite probably already too late. Far, far too late…
They would sacrifice their own relatives if it served the greater good. In fact, perhaps they already have?
The most devious schemes, the most perfidious plots, the most underhanded motives.
The most minute, accurate flick of the wrist; the sharpest eye – craftsmen ensure that no two works are ever the same.
It may not seem that way, but stuffing your face well past the point dictated by common sense, is something of an art.
As one can learn the craftsman's art, or that of the assassin, so one can also learn betrayal, in all its myriad, shameful forms.
A charge, fuelled by stern hearts and even sterner blades, will rip enemy lines apart.
The strength of the two sisters together in battle makes all alies better prepared for the fight.
The attacks fall with such consistency that they are as a rain of strikes falling upon the foe.
One shot, timed and aimed to perfection, is often more important than a thousand wasted volleys.
To the very bitter end and beyond, if possible, to the very last breath, they will be constant and unswerving.
A shining, typical, and above all appropriate model of how one should be.
The thing to fear is not the bolt itself, but the dark and toxic unguent coated across its ever-increasing tip.
There is a time, dishonourable though it may appear in the moment, when living to fight again another day is by far the most sensible option.
Only through sober and considered analysis can fragility be turned to unerring strength.
Stealth itself, and great patience, are essential skills if you wish to ensnare your target.
It is an established fact to friends, but never to foes, that two Zhangs are better than one.
Oft-times, ephemeral things can fixed until they are as good as new; not so people, however.
The responsibility that comes with authority should not be taken lightly.
Be cunning and full of tricks and your people shall never be destroyed.
Martial expertise from hard work. Practice. Preparation. Endless repetition.
Concentrate on the moment: fight, don't think. Use your instincts.
A hero's resolve is not to seem the bravest, but to be it.
The ways of the land are known to those who have trodden these paths their entire lives.
There is a price for every action. Especially war.
That which is a dealt to the enemy, must also be felt in return. This is the exchange.
A tenacious style of leadership inspires all warriors to keep fighting!
Everyone has a weak spot. Finding it, then exploiting it, is the cornerstone of victory.
The Nanman are proud warriors, and display their battle readiness appropriately.
When all else fails, great strength is found in the last-ditch desperation of man.
…and the arrows shall fall from above like a deluge from heaven.
One should always be careful not to lower their defences in battle.
These daggers are said never to miss. Not once. Ever.
The rage of battle overtakes any warrior, leading them never to relent.
Resolve unwavering, endurance seemingly increasing, despite the onslaught continuing.
The land gives protection to those who would offer themselves in its defence.
A warrior should really watch his footwork more closely.
These that heaven has put together shall now put their foes asunder.
Should this blow strike true, the battle is done. Should it not, then… it may still also be done.
A well-placed, and overbearingly powerful, strike will fell any enemy's defences.
The tribes of the south do not take kindly, and fight with great power, any aggressive interlopers.
Against their sheer force and imposing presence, enemies find it harder to keep their focus and martial acuity.
One foot in front of the other in rapid succession – this is the key to swiftness.
The forest provides a path, and surer footing, for the respectful.
Upon nearby enemy unit routing nearby own units recieve a morale buff.
Nature itself provides a shield for its warriors.
A charge, fuelled by stern hearts and even sterner blades, will rip enemy lines apart.
Careful calculation and consideration will get you more than the most aggressive strike.
All who gaze upon you must have no indication of your biases.
To hold power over court you must be able to choose your words carefully.
You are emperor. Act like it.
Those who fear you, respect you.
Burn brightly, but do not extinguish the flames of those around you.
Nothing baffles evil like calm composure and propriety.
Liu Zhang calls a ceasefire for all nearby units, delaying the enemy while his allies work on a counter-attack.
When another member of the Yuan clan is on the field, familial rivalry will push the other to greater feats.
Cao Ren's presence on the battlefield can give hope to his men, even in the most dire of situations.
With a shout, Yan Liang spurs on his horse. He can plough into enemies with such force that scores of men go flying.
Zhang He has a great understanding of geography, and can bend it to his own use.
Yu Jin is as an immovable wall, inspiring his men to stand firm against much greater odds.
Fa Zheng accosts the enemy hero, shaking them to the core.
Liu Yan rallies his troops to greater feats, inspiring them to make one final effort.
Wen Chou flies into a rage, embodying the mighty Xiezhi, a mythical creature of great power.

inspiring_surge
unyielding_earth

Raise your sail one foot and you get ten feet of wind.
Coherence in thought and speech brings clear advantage.
The pillar is strongest at its base.
Everyone eats and drinks, yet only few appreciate the taste of food.
Burn long, and brightly.
Strike with violence. Always.
Never forget, never forgive.
Do not hold back what clamours for release.
Nothing baffles evil like calm composure and propriety.
Those who fear nothing do not stumble along life's rubble-strewn path.
Understanding cannot be taught, only felt instinctively.
Never lose sight of the prize, no matter the obstacles along the way.
What you do not wish upon yourself, extend not to others.
The industrious need no orders to galvanise them into action.
Accuracy safeguards energy, so it is never wasted.
Like the weather, one's fortune may change by the evening.
The crafty fox evades the farmer's blade.
Abandon fixed ideas, they will only hold you back.
